page.title: 11Seasonal Events in Pencombe
page.content: The annual Road Race is usually held in June and in 1985 a record 72 runners participated. There are two races _ the Open over a distance of 4.7 miles and the Ladies race over 2.8 miles. The first 1 1/4 miles in both races is a gruelling climb of 275 ft from Pencombe to Hegdon Hill. A very different story in winter when snowdrifts across the narrow roads to Pencombe can quickly cut the village off. In January 1982 the villagers were stranded for a week. Several of the menfolk together walked the three miles to Bromyard for supplies for themselves and neighbours. To add to everyone's discomfort the electricity was also cut off. The snow causes great hardship to the outlying farms as these can be inaccessible to vehicles, delaying milk collection and delivery of essential farm supplies.
